conversation.content: [trembling] Encontrei discrepâncias nos, [swallowing hard], relatórios trimestrais que remontam a três anos e todas, [voice cracking], levam a decisões que autorizei sem, [desperate], perceber o que realmente significavam.

[defeated] Dou-te tudo mas, quer dizer, quando isto vier ao de cima, a minha carreira acabou, [bitter], a minha reputação destruída, e, hum, 20 anos a construir a minha vida profissional simplesmente, [hollow], desaparecidos. [long pause]

original_conversation.content: [trembling] I found discrepancies in the, [swallowing hard], quarterly reports that go back three years and they all, [voice cracking], trace back to decisions I signed off on without, [desperate], realizing what they actually meant.
You need to stop talking immediately and, [firm], understand that everything you say to me is protected but, [measured], anything else you've told anyone could destroy you. [exhales sharply]
But I mean, I was just, umm, trying to, [panicked], meet the board's expectations and somehow the numbers got away from me.

[cold] The SEC doesn't care about your intentions when there's, [calculating], twelve million in misreported revenue sitting in, [sharp], offshore accounts with your signature authorizing every transfer.
[defensive] Those accounts were supposed to be, [frustrated], temporary holding for international acquisitions that never materialized.
Temporary becomes permanent when, umm, three years pass and you're still, [incredulous], moving money through shell companies, I mean, what were you thinking?
[desperate] Every CFO does creative accounting to, [voice breaking], smooth earnings but I never meant for it to, [shaking], cross into fraud territory.

[intense] Now that's something I can, umm, work with but you'll need to, [demanding], document every conversation, every email, and, [urgent], every implied threat they made. [pauses]

[shocked] Wait, you have recordings? [stunned]
[exhausted] Hours of them, um, stored on encrypted drives that I've been, well, too terrified to even listen to again. [sighs heavily]
[urgent] Those recordings could be the difference between, umm, you testifying as a witness versus, [grave], serving ten years in federal prison, so I need them, well, immediately. [demanding]

[defeated] I'll give you everything but, I mean, once this comes out, my career is over, [bitter], my reputation destroyed, and, umm, twenty years of building my professional life just, [hollow], gone. [long pause]
[softer] Your career might survive.
How can you say that when, um, every financial institution will see me as either, [self-loathing], criminally negligent or just another corrupt executive who got caught?

[strategic] Because whistleblowers who help convict bigger fish often, [careful], get second chances, especially when they can prove, [confident], they were manipulated by people with real power. [determined]
